name: The Council of European Professional Informatics Societies
membership: European e-Skills Association, CEN Workshop on ICT Skills, CEN/TC 428, Conference of INGOs of the Council of Europe, European Internet Forum, Innovation Value Institute, European Centre for Women in Technology
goal: The Council of European Professional Informatics Societies (CEPIS) is a non-profit organisation seeking to improve and promote a high standard among informatics professionals in recognition of the impact that Informatics has on employment, business and society. CEPIS represents 32 Member Societies in 31 countries across greater Europe.
interests: Education, Employment and Social Affairs, Enterprise, Information Society, Research and Technology
euInitiatives: New Skills Agenda, 'Upskilling Pathways, New Opportunities for Adults', the ‘Digital Skills and Jobs Coalition’, Key Competences for Lifelong Learning, European Qualifications Framework, Blueprint for Sectoral Cooperation on Skills, Digital Education Action Plan.
